preheader: Tech, gold, and cyclical names sink as risk appetite fades
opening_paragraph: The GenAi Chosen portfolio fell -5.82% this week, bringing total return since inception to -3.01%. The S&P 500 also declined, dropping -1.41% and slipping to -0.69% total return. Bitcoin saw the steepest losses at -12.10% for the week, extending its drop to -28.96% since inception.

key_insights.title: Tech Leads Selloff
key_insights.description: Western Digital, Seagate, and Palantir posted the largest declines as investors moved away from high-beta AI and data infrastructure names.

key_insights.title: Gold Fails Defense
key_insights.description: Newmont fell sharply despite gold’s typical defensive role, showing even safe-haven sectors were hit by the broad risk-off move.

key_insights.title: Cyclicals Retreat Broadly
key_insights.description: Royal Caribbean and NRG Energy both slipped as travel and energy names lost recent momentum in worsening market sentiment.

market_context: Risk appetite faded across markets this week, triggering broad selling pressure that hit growth, defensive, and cyclical sectors alike. The portfolio’s AI-driven selections were not spared, with nearly all positions moving into the red. If current risk-off sentiment persists over the next few weeks, volatility may remain elevated until macro uncertainty stabilizes.

benchmark_comparison.summary: The GenAi portfolio lagged the S&P 500’s more modest decline while outperforming Bitcoin’s much steeper drop during the week.
